channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Campus protests over Gaza could affect graduation; Steve Inkseep interviews Blinken
item.description: Hundreds of students have been arrested at pro-Palestinian protests at colleges nationwide. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Antony Blinken in an exclusive interview about U.S.-China relations.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of students have been arrested at pro-Palestinian protests at colleges nationwide. NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Antony Blinken in an exclusive interview about U.S.-China relations.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Trump's immunity arguments and the experiences of the justices who might support it
item.description: Five of the six conservatives spent much of their lives in the Beltway, working in the White House and Justice Department, seeing their administrations as targets of unfair harassment by Democrats.
item.content:encoded:
Five of the six conservatives spent much of their lives in the Beltway, working in the White House and Justice Department, seeing their administrations as targets of unfair harassment by Democrats.

(Image credit: Olivier Douliery)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: What to know about a possible Israeli military offensive in Rafah
item.description: In Gaza's southernmost city, where more than a million Palestinians have sought shelter and where aid groups have centralized operations, worries have grown over a possible Israeli military operation.
item.content:encoded:
In Gaza's southernmost city, where more than a million Palestinians have sought shelter and where aid groups have centralized operations, worries have grown over a possible Israeli military operation.

(Image credit: Mohammed Abed)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: More than 500 people have been arrested at pro-Palestinian protests at colleges
item.description: Students and others are protesting Israel's war against Hamas in Gaza and, in some cases, their school's investments in Israel. Presidents at several schools face calls to resign amid the protests.
item.content:encoded:
Students and others are protesting Israel's war against Hamas in Gaza and, in some cases, their school's investments in Israel. Presidents at several schools face calls to resign amid the protests.

(Image credit: Mike Stewart)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: United Methodist Church begins reorganization over LGBTQ+ issues
item.description: The United Methodist Church has voted to restructure itself in a way that could allow for LGBTQ+ clergy and same-sex weddings.
item.content:encoded:
The United Methodist Church has voted to restructure itself in a way that could allow for LGBTQ+ clergy and same-sex weddings.

(Image credit: David Goldman)
item.dc:creator: Jason DeRose

item.title: A year later, Florida businesses say the state's immigration law dealt a huge blow.
item.description: Florida passed in 2023 one of the strictest immigration laws in the country, and now businesses struggle to find workers in several sectors of the economy
item.content:encoded: Florida passed in 2023 one of the strictest immigration laws in the country, and now businesses struggle to find workers in several sectors of the economy
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Former tabloid publisher details actions on behalf of Trump ahead of 2016 election
item.description: David Pecker, the former publisher of the National Enquirer, told prosecutors he killed stories that potentially could have hurt Donald Trump during his run for the White House in 2016.
item.content:encoded:
David Pecker, the former publisher of the National Enquirer, told prosecutors he killed stories that potentially could have hurt Donald Trump during his run for the White House in 2016.

(Image credit: Mark Peterson)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Bernstein

item.title: Alabama woman who says police assaulted her after calling 911 files federal lawsuit
item.description: Twyla Stallworth, a woman from Andalusia, Ala., filed a federal lawsuit against the city, its police department and Grant Barton, the police officer involved in the incident.
item.content:encoded: Twyla Stallworth, a woman from Andalusia, Ala., filed a federal lawsuit against the city, its police department and Grant Barton, the police officer involved in the incident.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: A Baltimore-area teacher is accused of using AI to make his boss appear racist
item.description: This wild case emphasizes the serious potential for criminal misuse of artificial intelligence that experts have been warning about for some time, one professor said.
item.content:encoded:
This wild case emphasizes the serious potential for criminal misuse of artificial intelligence that experts have been warning about for some time, one professor said.

(Image credit: Michael Dwyer)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Where can you call an artist on a lobster? Find out in the quiz
item.description: Plus, Tesla's next move, Taylor's new record and why zoo animals (sometimes) get weird during eclipses.
item.content:encoded: Plus, Tesla's next move, Taylor's new record and why zoo animals (sometimes) get weird during eclipses.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris
